title.rendered: Professional Aircraft Accessories Growth Leads to the Addition of New Positions

content.rendered:
Professional Aircraft Accessories, a Greenwich AeroGroup company, announced today that Wayne Trzeciak has joined the company as Vice President of Supply Chain.

“Wayne brings with him years of experience and industry knowledge unrivaled in the aftermarket,” said Professional Aircraft Accessories President Robert Bial. “He will add another dimension in our effort to improve efficiencies in the face of our continued growth.”

Trzeciak most recently served as the Manager of Spares Support for Honda Aircraft Company and prior to that spent 29 years in various leadership positions within Bombardier Aerospace Service Centers where he was consistently recognized for exceeding productivity, efficiency, financial, customer and quality objectives.

“Wayne will help orchestrate and enhance a more streamlined and efficient material management system and will complement an already talented supply chain team.  After years as one of our customers, I am thrilled he has decided to join the PAA Family,” Bial added.

In addition to the employment of Trzeciak, Bial promoted Gary McCracken from Director of Technical Operations to Vice President and Jeff Robbins from Director of Sales to Vice President. Bial said “these changes will help ensure the high levels of satisfaction our customers have come to expect from us will continue for years to come.”
